intro: Elaeodendron rehmannii, commonly known as the African sandthorn, is a small shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or rocky soils. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes used in landscaping in regions with dry climates.
